data:
{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3416268,"name":"segev","username":"se.sa","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f0a364/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T14:48:03.790Z","cooked":"

My team and I have been using 3D printers for a while now, and we want to replace a printer with a better one. We have been using the Prusa MK3 printer, and we didn‚Äôt have any big problems since then. We wanted to buy a printer that is faster for creating prototypes and big prints, but we also wanted to be able to print things that we were never able to. One of the things that we print the most are pulleys and different parts of the robot. Our main materials are mostly TPU and PLA, but we would like to start using more kinds of filaments.
When we print pulleys, we make the outer part TPU and the inner PLA. To do so we use two different printers to create each part of the pulley.
Our dilemmas about the new printer are whether we should buy a printer that is fast but most likely able to print in one color at a time or if we should buy a printer that can do things that we were never able to, for example, printing in multiple colors and materials, allowing us to print things like the pulleys in one print. We were thinking of purchasing the Prusa XL because of its capability to print fast using various colors, and materials; but at the same time, it‚Äôs not the fastest at printing single-material prints.
Our budget is around 3,000-3,500$ or around 10,000-12,000 nis
Do you have any recommendations about what kind of printers would suit us the best?

Thank you for helping!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T14:48:03.790Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4165,"reads":755,"readers_count":754,"score":20996.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"segev","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67210,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3416273,"name":"Leo","username":"leo-les","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T15:12:46.816Z","cooked":"

Buy 2 Bambu Lab X1 Carbons or 3 Prusa Mk4s‚Äôs. I‚Äôd personally go with the Bambu Labs but there are arguments for both.

If all you‚Äôre printing is small pulleys and parts there is no need to get a Prusa XL. get 2-3 cheaper printers in order to have a higher throughput of different prints. Trying to print TPU and PLA in a print seems like more trouble then its worth. What is the reasoning behind it? We use PETG for all of our pulleys, PLA is way too weak for frc use.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T15:17:03.217Z","reply_count":4,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":723,"readers_count":722,"score":394.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Leo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3128 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/2","custom_user_title":"3128 Alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416274,"name":"Pizzatc","username":"Pizzatc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pizzatc/{size}/207342_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T15:14:03.799Z","cooked":"

The Bambu Lab A1‚Äôs are a great printer for the price. For $340 right now they are very fast, can print in a 10x10x10 build volume, have a camera to monitor ongoing prints, and have other features to keep the bed level to ensure build quality comes out nice.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T15:14:03.799Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":693,"readers_count":692,"score":213.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Pizzatc","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54022,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2659"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/3","custom_user_title":"2659","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416276,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T15:19:42.926Z","cooked":"

Bambu x1 knocks everything else out of the water right now unless you are running a print shop and need to do many parallel bulk jobs.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T15:19:42.926Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":663,"readers_count":662,"score":262.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/4","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416277,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T15:55:29.977Z","cooked":"
Pizzatc:

The Bambu Lab A1‚Äôs are a great printer for the price.

I agree, but also it seems like it‚Äôs incompatible with their ambitions:

se.sa:

Our main materials are mostly TPU and PLA, but we would like to start using more kinds of filaments.

That said, I would like to understand why they‚Äôre printing the outer parts of their pulleys in TPU and how well it‚Äôs working for them.

leo-les:

We use PETG for all of our pulleys, PLA is way too weak for frc use.

Respectfully, baloney (and I‚Äôm a PETG fan). PLA can be plenty, if your settings are correct or you back it up with the Thrifty inserts. We ran the whole season with the same PLA pulleys on our Everybot amp mechanism.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:02:59.440Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":3,"incoming_link_count":28,"reads":640,"readers_count":639,"score":408.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/5","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416278,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T15:56:59.867Z","cooked":"
leo-les:

Buy 2 Bambu Lab X1 Carbons or 3 Prusa Mk4s‚Äôs

Or 4 P1S

The P1s is just as capable as the x1c with less exotic filaments, and if you wanted to get into printing abrasives, the hardened steel nozzle upgrade is quite affordable.

se.sa:

whether we should buy a printer that is fast but most likely able to print in one color at a time or if we should buy a printer that can do things that we were never able to, for example, printing in multiple colors and materials, allowing us to print things like the pulleys in one print.

I‚Äôve found that being able to switch colors is less useful/practical than it seems. It greatly slows down print times and increases material usage. Multi-material is also finnicky- ymmv, but if you‚Äôve got a system for making your pullies separately that‚Äôs likely going to be more reliable, faster and more efficient than printing in one print job.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:04:26.293Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":578,"readers_count":577,"score":280.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/6","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416279,"name":"Pizzatc","username":"Pizzatc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pizzatc/{size}/207342_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T16:14:35.527Z","cooked":"

Ah I somehow missed the part about multiple colors then yeah the X1‚Äôs are probably a safer bet

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:14:35.527Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":520,"readers_count":519,"score":114.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Pizzatc","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54022,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2659"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/7","custom_user_title":"2659","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416281,"name":"829 The Digital Goats Official Curmudgeon. ","username":"IndySam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/indysam/{size}/111341_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T16:19:34.372Z","cooked":"
Ryan_Blue:

The P1s is just as capable as the x1c with less exotic filaments, and if you wanted to get into printing abrasives, the hardened steel nozzle upgrade is quite affordable.

No it‚Äôs not. I love printing up to 8 colors on my Bambu but the amount of waste is insane.

I also love my XL but unless I need the size I still use my mini‚Äôs a lot.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:19:54.528Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":138.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"829 The Digital Goats Official Curmudgeon. ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5305,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416283,"name":"","username":"DaiTou567","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T16:22:57.535Z","cooked":"

Bambus definitely have the edge over Prusa with your current budget right now. To get similar out of the box performance on a Prusa would be far more expensive, considering that the MK4 doesn‚Äôt come with an enclosure or a multi-filament setup like the X1 Combo does. I‚Äôve worked with both the MK4 with an MMU as well as an X1 Combo, and the MMU was an absolute pain to setup and tinker with. Not to mention that the Core-XY of the Bambu simply has more out of the box speed than the Prusa bedslinger. Go with the Bambu, your life will be easier .

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:26:22.793Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":506,"readers_count":505,"score":116.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/9","custom_user_title":"2429 Alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416284,"name":"Brendan Conover","username":"bcon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcon/{size}/169080_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T16:29:31.874Z","cooked":"
IndySam:

No it‚Äôs not.

Yes, it is.

The P1S is comparable to a stripped down, yet still capable version of the X1C. Upgrade the nozzle to hardened steel and it can do just about anything the X1C can.

OP, both Bambu Labs machines or Prusa MK4S will work fine for your applications. I recommend the Bambu X1C/P1S from an FRC standpoint due to their speed, print quality, and overall reliability from what I‚Äôve seen at this time. We printed somewhere between 40-60 kg of filament on 2 Bambu Lab X1C last season with minimal issues.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:29:31.874Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":479,"readers_count":478,"score":285.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/10","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416285,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T16:51:33.858Z","cooked":"

Bambu P1S is one of my personal choice under your requirement. Mainly because it is an enclosed printer.

With your budget, I would suggest buy at least one machine with the AMS. You can‚Äôt use AMS for TPU but for an unattended large print , you could load serval filament that is the same onto the AMS and when one spool runs out it will automatically kicks in another spool. Also with the AMS you could use Bambu Support for PLA filament which makes removing support so much easier especially if you‚Äôre printing complicated parts.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":67,"updated_at":"2024-08-18T16:51:47.643Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":460,"readers_count":459,"score":122.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469975,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-best-3d-printer","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://ca.store.bambulab.com/products/support-for-pla","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Support for PLA | Bambu Lab CA","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-best-3d-printer/469975/11","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3416289,"name":null,"username":"veg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/3be4f8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-18T17:19:26.411Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm a huge proponent of Bambu. They are fast and reliable and have great output quality. They will not mix different materials however, so you‚Äôll still be printing TPU separately from your PLA and putting the parts together later.

I echo what others have said about multi-filament handling in general being slow and wasteful, but if you can limit the multi-color printing to just a few layers it isn‚Äôt all that bad, and can be used to great effect making signage.

RobotsUpstairs1920√ó1440 211 KB

‚ÄúVoron‚Äù.

I did not join Team 97 in time to be part of build season, but I have multiple Voron printers personally and when I see the struggles we had with 3D printed parts, I‚Äôm pretty sure that this upcoming year, the Vorons will be part of the answer. I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôd recommend them to anyone as their first printer, but if you‚Äôve got someone with a little bit of 3D printer experience under their belt, I think the V0 is great for fast, small part prototyping and a Trident, Switchwire, or 2.4 would be great for larger prints.

(They are not as consumer, no-knowledge-needed as a Prusa, Bambu, or even Ender.)

bcon:

Yes, it is.

The P1S is comparable to a stripped down, yet still capable version of the X1C. Upgrade the nozzle to hardened steel and it can do just about anything the X1C can.

I respectfully disagree. Size, waste, being able to use different materials It‚Äôs just not.

Having said that I will and have recommended Bambu as a first, second, third‚Ä¶ printer. I can‚Äôt imagine a serious print shop without one.

I use a Bambu Labs P1S with the AMS sitting at the side. After a few tweaks, it has been a reliable printer and prints at least twice as fast as the other printers I use. This makes iterative improvements on a part much faster. These are the modifications I made to improve reliability:

  • Printed a guide in PETG to ensure the PTFE tube exiting the extruder bends at a consistent radius
  • Moved the AMS to the right side of the P1S instead of sitting it on top. I had issues with Slot 3 when it was on the top due to the extra bend in the Bowden tube

For things that require a material you can‚Äôt or don‚Äôt want to try to print on something like the P1S (e.g. nylon, polycarbonate), you might consider iterating with PLA and then sending it to an online service.
